choices: Male, day shift
Male, night shift
Female, day shift
Female, night shift
Meh, you know what? Screw this, I'm getting a job at the car wash!
1.content: Right, before we get started I need to know two things: What is your gender and what shift do you prefer?
1.title: Beats working at Denny's

choices: Go clean the filthy restrooms
Restock the shelves
Grab a drink from the freezer
Take a break and go for a walk outside
Dick around until a customer finally comes in
11.content: You gaze longingly at the peaceful blue sky outside just beyond the dirty glass window. With a sigh you force yourself to turn away and look at the clock to see how much longer you'd be held prisoner in this place. "10:37 am...!" You groan in frustration as you lean over the counter and look back out the window. It was only your first day and it was dragging on as if you'd worked here your whole life. The only customer that had even come in so far was a fat middle-aged woman who was way too affectionate with her dog. You glance back at the clock to see that it is now 10:41 am. Seems like you need something to pass the time...
11.title: Workin' 9 to 5

choices: Call a buddy to help you out...
Calm yourself with a joint before heading inside...
Fuck this, no job is worth losing my sanity to a public toilet!
111.content: You remember your boss telling you to clean the restroom before you left today and that if you didn't he'd hire someone else. "Oh god... this is gonna be fun." You say sarcasticly as you step out from the behind the counter, leaving a "back in 5 minutes" sign in case a customer does show up. "That damn place is probably a biohazard by now..." You grumble as you insert the key into the lock and open the door to the smelly hell that awaited you inside. The entrance had not been opened an inch before a cloud of toxic air assaulted your unprotected nostrils. "Oh sweet baby Jesus on a unicycle! My nose!" You groan as you slam the door shut and puke a little bit onto the ground. You needed this job, but the task at hand was far too much for one man alone to handle by himself. What you need now is something to take the edge off...
111.title: Abandon hope, all ye who enter here...

choices: Your best friend
Your kickass army buddy
Satan
1111.content: You slowly back away from the hazard zone, pull out your phone and quickly dial up a number. You hated the idea of going back in there, but this job was your only source of income at the moment and you didn't want to lose it. The next time you opened that door you wouldn't be doing it alone, however, and would have a close friend backing you up. Speaking of which, who did you call to help you out?
1111.title: Send In The Backup!

choices: A shiny coin
A bag of dice
A ouija board
11111.content:
You decided to dial up your good friend Billy, who worked part time as an exterminator and had access to the closest thing to a hazmat suit as you were likely to get. In just a few minutes his van pulls up and he waves to your from the parking lot. "Hey Billy, thanks for dropping by on such short notice." you say as he tosses you a gas mask.

"No problem, man. I've had to work at a crappy summer job too, just last year I worked at the Cheesy Jesus Pizzeria for my smelly old boss Bob." he replies as he puts on his own mask. "Oh yeah, didn't he fire you?" you ask as the two of you walk back to the hellhole your manager considered a public restroom.

"No, he called me a long haired hippy so I shot him in the face with a twelve gauge and bribed the witnesses." Billy replied as he kicked the door to the bathroom open. "Why do you think I work as an exterminator now? No more sweet, sweet money to bribe the cops away. If I shot my boss now I'd have to dispose of the body myself, along with all the people screaming about how "shooting your boss in the face is wrong" and junk. Too much hassle, man."

You decide to keep quiet and silently wonder if you need to get some new friends as you and Billy decontaminate the toilet. Fortunately, the time passes quickly and your eyes only burned when you inhaled, blinked or thought about blinking. "Hey, what's this?" Billy calls out as he plunges his hand into the toilet bowl and you struggle not to vomit on the inside of your mask.

When Billy pulls his hand back out form the sixth circle of hell he is holding...
11111.title: Treasure In The Toilet

choices: "HEADS!"
"TAILS!"
"Fuck this nonsense..."
111111.content:
With a nauseating splash Billy holds up his prize for you to see better. In his hand was a surprisingly clean gold coin that was about twice the size of a quarter. On one side was a cross and on the other was the head of a person you had never seen before. It looked old, but still had a strange luster to it... and almost looked like it even had a faint glow in the dim light. Weird.

"Somebody's probably sad that they dropped this bad boy when they were droppin' a deuce." Billy says with a laugh as he tosses the coin up in the air. The thing does a few flips and manages to land perfectly on its side in the palm of his hand. "Whoa, what are the odds of that?" Billy giggles as he tosses the coin a second time. "Call it! Heads or tails, broski!"

The coin hits the floor right as you call out your answer.
111111.title: Coin Flip

choices: "I wish the gas station was filled with porn stars, strippers and pudding!"
"I wish I had a monster truck filled with $100 bills! And pudding!"
"I wish I had even more magical weed! Heh heh... oh, and some pudding."
1112.content: You head back to the front counter and take a small box from your backpack. "Everybody in this country already has a gun, why not give them some blunts too? Firearms can kill people, but plants are soooo much more dangerous!" You say sarcasticly as you open the lid, grab one of the small papers along with some marijuana, and begin rolling a joint. Suddenly, in a poof of smoke, a floating gnome appears out of thin air! "Oh come on! I haven't even lit this thing yet!" You grumble as the gnome introduces himself. "Greetings hashhead, I'm Mordecai, the magical pot gnome! You've just rolled a joint using some of the premo stuff I grow in my own patch back home in the magical land of New Jersey! For that I've enchanted this weed to give you a wish for every joint you smoke! Have fun now!" With that he disappears in a another puff of smoke and your weed stash begins glowing. "Huh..." You say as you light up the joint. "I though this was just the cheap stuff I usually buy for $20 an ounce. Guess that one-eyed hobo with the naked fairy tattoo I buy from wasn't just a drug-selling bum after all... he was a MAGICAL drug-selling bum!" Whelp, you've about smoked this joint all the way up... time to see if that guy was telling the truth. Make a wish!
1112.title: Pot control is not the same as gun control...

choices: You invite some friends over to join in the fun...
You wake up the next day to a completely wrecked gas station...
11121.content: You weren't sure that the gnome, the magic pot, or anything that was going on right now was real... but you didn't care. In fact, you couldn't have given a fuck less... There were busty young women dancing on the tops of the shelves like you were at a strip club and a small swimming pool filled with pudding was about to play host to some bikini wrestling in the parking lot outside. There was even a playboy bunny making out with a porn star over in the corner next to a stripper pole that appeared out of nowhere only a few seconds ago. "This is so fucking awesome!" You shout as you grab a beer from the cooler, light up another joint and begin the party...
11121.title: Porn star dancing!

choices: RUN!
There HAS to be some of that magic pot still here somewhere...!
111212.content:
The last thing you remembered from last night was a wet t-shirt contest and a drink cocktail that sounded like something a guy on death row might order. The gas station was now in a complete ruin and everything around you showed the devistation of your manic party. The windows were all busted, there was spilt drinks and torn open food packages on the floor, vomit colored every wall, and you were pretty sure that there was a dead hooker stuffed with blow on top of the ice box outside. "Oh god... that was the best night of my life!" You say as you struggle to keep from choking on puke, which is pretty hard with all the toxins swimming around in your body. As you get up off the floor you notice a deep cut on your knee was bleeding a little, causing a thin red streak to run down your pant leg. Not only that, but you also seemed to have a pierced ear, nipple, and... uh, lower area. That must have been a damn good time you had last night.


"Woo-wheee... that was fun. Now where did I put the rest of that magic pot? I couldn't have smoked it all..." You say as you step over a few of the sleeping naked women on your way back to the front counter. "Oh nope, here's the box. I still got some." Just then, you hear the sound of police sirens coming down the road outside. "Oh crap, guess I better do something before they find this place like this. One wish should take care of that..." You say as you pull the lid off the box... only to see that the inside is completely empty. "What?! Oh no, oh no, OH SHIT!" You yell as you try to think of something to do. If the police catch you like this you'll go to jail for sure, better think fast...
111212.title: Buzzkill time!

choices: Fuck it, you might as well just go for it at this point...
Its not worth the risk, some prison time is better than becoming a bullet sponge
1112122.content:
You knew you wouldn't have a chance to get away clean from a mess this big and were sure there JUST HAD to be one more hit of the sticky icky here somewhere. You look all over the counter and began pushing aside bits of trash as you look around desperately for any small bit of the magic weed that might have made it out of your little party unsmoked. "Shit, I know we didn't smoke all of that stuff, I always keep a little bit for the next day. There has to some in here somewhere!" You shout as you move away from the counter and begin looking over the sleeping bodies scattered around the floor as a few police cars pull up outside. "Damn it, they're here! I can't even try to run now...!"


Just as you are about to give up hope and turn yourself over to the cops outside you notice something in the hand of a blonde woman slumped up against the snack rack. In her hand was a spliff that must have gone out after she fell asleep. It was almost completely burned up, but had just enough left to get in a quick drag and save you from a new home behind iron bars. "Thank god!" You say as you walk over... only for a couple of police officers to bust in through the front door just as you take it out of her hand. "Freeze motherfucker!" One of them yells as they point handguns at your face. You are about to put your hands up and surrender when you notice a small fire burning away in the far corner of the room. If you could just get this thing lit... "Don't move or we'll shoot!" The other cop calls as they begin moving closer.
1112122.title: "What seems to be the problem officers?"

choices: Wish to be teleported to New Jersey
Wish for superpowers
Wish for something to bribe the cops with
11121221.content: You put your hands up to catch them off guard before diving behind a snack rack as they open fire. A stray shot cuts a nice gash in your side, but you're still able to run. Luckily, the cops follow behind you as you circle around and make a leap for the fire. You manage to light up the weed just as they corner you with their guns ready to fire again. "This is your last warning, move again and you die." one of them says as he whips out a pair of handcuffs and begins walking towards you. As your thoughts begin racing you inhale the smoke and wish for the first thing you can think of...
11121221.title: Make It Count!

choices: Find that gnome dude and get some more of his magic weed
Visit your friend downtown and see if he'll let you crash at his place
Figure out a way to make some quick cash
111212211.content:
In an instant the cops, the gas station and the horrible mess inside all vanish in a flash of light as you find yourself stumbling over a trash can and falling onto a stack of flattened cardboard boxes. All around you could be heard the sounds of various crimes and fighting between thugs, lowlifes and cops. Immediately you felt both relief that you had escaped the police and regret that you were now stranded in New Jersey. Oh, and you were probably fired from your job too.

"Fuckshit!" you curse as you spit out the burnt up weed and hop to your feet. "I'm alone, I'm fucked up and I'm stranded in one of the worst cities on the planet." You rub your head as you walk past a hobo sipping on a cheap bottle of whiskey and step out onto the sidewalk. "First, I need to find out exactly where I am and get some help. I'll have to worry about fixing things later."

With that you begin to think up a plan of action...
111212211.title: A Quick Escape...

choices: Time for another joint!
Screw that, see what happens if you make a wish with a blunt...
11122.content: A large thump sounds outside as something falls on top of your car, crushing it flat. You turn around just in time to see a large cloud of smoke disappear and leave behind a jumbo sized green monster truck with a shitload of money in the back. (Yes, shitload is a real unit of measurement. You're high, remember?) "Oh wow, now I'm starting to wish I had wished for scantily clad women and pudding. Alas, this joint is smoked and I have recieved my bitchin' monster truck filled with money and... Hey! Where's my pudding?!" You ask angrily as you finish off the joint and put it out. A few more seconds pass before a giant ten gallon tub of chocolate pudding falls into the back of the truck on top of the money with a "Sorry 4 teh delay." sign taped to the side. "Oh, there it is. Well, I suppose its better late than never."
11122.title: Party like its 420!

choices: Join the local girl scouts and sell cookies to raise money
Begin work at the local tampon packaging factory
Um, maybe you SHOULD give collage a second try after all...
1113.content: You really need a job, but the one you have now isn't worth the meager paycheck that passes for minimum wage these days. Unfortunately, all you have is a lowly high school education... damn, you should have listened to your mother and went to collage. Oh well, nothing you can do now... except try to find a job one step above public toilet cleaner.
1113.title: Slim pickings...

choices: "I'd better meet the team if we're gonna be working together."
"I REALLY hate to ask, but you got my uniform for me?"
"So what exactly are we gonna be selling?"
11131.content:
Luckily (or unluckily) for you the local girl scouts were currently in a pretty bad turf war with those damn brownie scouts and couldn't afford to turn any new recruits, no matter how unqualified they might be. You sigh and curse your luck as you ring the doorbell on your new squad leaders house. You were going to replace a girl named Meg who got capped by some brownie bitch when she tried slingin' mint chocolate chip down at the park next to the supermarket and had to pick up your new uniform as well as sit in on your first scout meeting with your new scout sisters. Joy.

The door opens as a small girl in a pink and green uniform greeted you with a smile. "Hello, are you here for the cookies or are you our new member?" You take a deep breath and sigh. You could already tell this was going to a complete nightmare and you hadn't even walked in the door yet.

"Yeah, I'm Meg's replacement... I'm here to pick up... my uniform... and... get to know my new scout sisters." you reply as the girl grins and pulls the door open to let you inside. "Oh goodie, those fucking shitstain brownie cunts really fucked poor Meg up when they caught her in their hood. Don't worry though, I poured a glass of milk out for her on the curb and got to talkin' with my homies, we'll get those bitches yet. By the way, I'm Jill, nice to meet ya new blood."

You rub your forehead and take a seat on the sofa in Jill's living room. "Well Jill, I'd like to get this over with and collect my first cookie check. Can we move this along please?" you ask as you look around the room at the various scout pictures and ribbons Jill's parents have decorated the house with.

"No problem new blood, no problem." Jill replies with a smile. "What do you want to do first?"
11131.title: Cute Kid

choices: The chief tampon packager becomes your rival
You become bored and humiliated enough to shoot yourself in the head
11132.content: You put in an application to the local tampon factory and surprisingly enough they trust you to handle feminine hygiene products (whatever keeps you farther away from the toxic waste and medical tools I suppose) enough to give you a job as a packager. Seriously, they apparently don't have a machine for this installed because they were waiting for someone as pathetic as you to show up. Anyway you don't complain (much) as you begin your first day on the job. Unfortunately...
11132.title: Maybe you could pull a few strings for a promotion

choices: The gym
The school store
11133.content: You can't really get into any of the better schools, but the one you do get accepted into is pretty decent. It was kinda small, but also right across the street from the liquer store and the pancake house. "Hopefully, I can find an okay job on campus before I graduate and spend the rest of my life as a janitor or something..." You say as you walk inside your dorm and unpack your stuff on the bed. From the looks of things your roommate already set up his stuff and left a short while ago. "Guess I better go have a look around this place before it gets too late... but where should I go first?" You wonder aloud as you head back outside. You'll probably only have time to explore one area before it gets too dark out... where will it be?
11133.title: Welcome to collage you magnificent frat bastard!

choices: Take a blue one
Take a red one
Politely decline for now
111332.content:
You take a few minutes to browse the surprisingly well stocked school store before deciding to buy a hat with the collage mascot (a mosquito, if you were wondering) on it and head over to the check out. The cashier looked to be another student such as yourself, but with long hippie dreds, a tye-dye shirt and a pair of psychedelic sunglasses. "This all, man?" he says in a friendly tone with a chuckle. You nod your head and give him the hat. "That'll be $19.69, bro." he says with another giggle as he pops what you assume is a breath mint and you hand him a twenty.

You take your bag and receipt and are just about to head out when he calls you to meet him over on the other end of the counter while a girl walks in to look over some sweaters and coats near the front door. You let out a sigh and walk over while looking out the front window at the setting sun. "Let's make this quick, I need to get back to the dorm soon." you say as the guy pops another mint and reaches into his pocket. "You new this year?" he asks as he gives you a smile.

"Yeah, I haven't even been here a day." you say cautiously as the guy pulls out a small clear container of brightly colored pills and dumps some into his hand. "You want one? They're free for all you new arrivals." he says in a way that makes you a bit uneasy. "What are they?" you ask as you stare down at the brightly colored tablets. "Were they what you were eating just now?" The guy just shakes his head and laughs. "Relax bro, I wouldn't break out the strong shit on you this early, go ahead and grab one." Do you?
111332.title: One Pill, Two Pill, Red Pill, Blue Pill...

choices: Restock the potato chips
Restock the snack cakes
Restock the candy
112.content: You decide that, since you have nothing better to do, you might as well restock the shelves so if a customer does ever come in they will atleast be able to find what they're looking for. There are 3 shelves that are missing items, which do you want to do first?
112.title: Seriously? You CHOSE to do this?

choices: You're a winner! Go get your money and kiss this hellhole goodbye!
You won a runner up prize! Leave work to claim your tropical island vacation!
You lost. Oh, and the boss'll probably make you pay for this can of pringles...
1121.content: You grab a box of Pringles from the back and begin restocking them when you drop a can of sour cream and onion on on the floor. You sit the box down and go to pick it up when you notice a contest printed on the side of the can with a $10,000 grand prize. "Oh, that's really too bad..." You say to yourself as you pop the top off the container. "It seems this can has been damaged... guess I'll just have to take it." With all the excitement of an adult child you pull the protective seal away to find...
1121.title: Once you pop...

choices: An imported sexbot
A cursed monkey's paw
An alchemist cookbook
11211.content: "FUCK YES!!!" You scream in joy as you run out the door and leave the gas station behind, hopefully forever. You turn in your winning notification and walk home $10,000 richer. Normally, you would probably just decide to blow this newfound wealth in a couple days on drugs, hookers, and video games, but because you pass by a strip mall on the way to your house you blow it right away. What useless trinket did you waste the prize money on?
11211.title: Actual job experiences may differ...

choices: Throughly read the manual
Skim over the important parts of the manual
Toss the manual, instructions are for babies
112111.content: You unbox the sexbot in the privacy of your basement (not sad at all...) and look over the instruction manual. Given that it was about 2 inches thick you decided to just read the chapter on starting up your new love toy. After pushing a button on the master control remote the mechanical lady hums to life as her eyes begin glowing with a soft blue light. "LOVE-UNIT 009 IS ONLINE. PLEASE INSERT JOYSTICK." it says in a hollow lifeless monotone. "Joystick? Does it mean that literally or figuratively?" you wonder as you begin flipping through pages of the manual.
112111.title: Only In America... (Or Japan...)

choices: An awesome cruise ship
A big fancy house
Your own air fortress
112112.content: You walk home and quickly head to your room before anyone you know sees you and quickly close the door. You stare down at the shriveled piece of fancy monkey jerky in your hands and begin dreaming up things to wish for. Of course, the guy who sold it to you warned of a curse that brought his last customer unending sorrow and misery, but that was all BS superstition. (You believe a severed primate paw has the power to grant you three wishes, but curses? Pfft, that's just dumb.) Anyway, what do you wish for?
112112.title: Monkey See, Monkey Wish...

choices: An elixir of immortality
A homunculus thrall to do your bidding
The perfect batch of cookies
112113.content:
You open the door to your room and sit your brand new dusty leather tome on your desk. Normally, you hated cooking but after seeing that cool anime about that guy who lost his limbs and turned his brother into a suit of armor you've always had a secret desire to try alchemy for yourself. You quickly unfasten the the worn strap binding the book shut and open it to a page filled with weird occult symbols and etchings.

As the pages begin radiating a soft blue light a part of you wonders if, maybe, just maybe, the arcane forces of the universe and alchemic magic were something too great for man to comprehend, that breaking nature's laws would bring only ruin, misery and destruction. Do you take responsibility for the great power you hold in your hands? Will you destroy this accursed source of forbidden knowledge and potentially avert disaster for all of humanity?!

Fuck that noise, you paid ten grand for this little bundle of paper. Now what are you gonna make first?
112113.title: Cooking Up Trouble

choices: You are landing on the tiny island of Zweiburia
People are screaming and part of the plane is torn off, you're going down!
11212.content: In less then 24 hours you're riding 3rd class on a plane crusing above Hawaii. You didn't win the big prize, but at least this vacation will give you a few days to yourself before you have to return to work. "This is your captain speaking, we will be landing in Zweiburia in less then 6 hours. For now, please enjoy the beautiful islands of Hawaii passing just below us." A voice sounding like an older man says over the loudspeaker. You were a bit disappointed that you weren't going to be visiting Hawaii, but maybe this Zweiburia would be even better. You finish your bag of stale peanuts and take a nap. When you wake up...
11212.title: Destination: Paradise

choices: Well then, the night is still young... time to party!
Head to the hotel to unpack and get some rest... tomorrow the fun begins!
112121.content: You arrive at the airport just as the sun begins setting and are greeted by a strange man in a white suit. "Greetings, ladies and gentleman and welcome to my own private little slice of heaven." He announces to the small crwod in a cheerful tone that reminded you a little of Vincent Price. "Jeez, little is right. There's no way this place is more than 3 miles long." You silently note to yourself as you stare out the window towards the long sandy beach and shimmering blue ocean. "But I do have to hand it to the guy, this place looks like a freakin' 5 star resort." You then listen as the man goes on to explain were the hotel and other facilities are as well as a few rules. "I'm sure you'll all enjoy your stay here... and please, if any of you have any questions don't hesitate to visit my mansion just up the hill. Edgar here will see you in." He says with a smile as he gestures first to a building off in the distance and then to his lumbering servant, who seemed like he might be more tank than human. "That is all, dear friends, I look forward to the time we'll all spend together..."
112121.title: Sun, sand, and creepy old guys...

choices: "A martini, to start."
"Some cute sounding drink that'll have me hugging the toilet all night."
1121211.content: You change into your swim trunks and head down to the beachside bar. "How much for a strong drink?" You ask the sexy bartender as you pull out your wallet. "Oh, all drinks are paid for by the resort and guests can have as many as they want. I can also mix you up a variety of special drinks if you'd like." She replies as she pulls a fresh glass from the shelf behind her and begins wiping it. "Whoa... this place IS 5 stars..." You say as you take a seat next to a tan woman with a seashell necklace. "Guess I'll have..."
1121211.title: FREE DRINKS! :D

choices: "Thanksh, but I'm fin. I'll besh okay..."
"Urmm, yesh, that'd... thash a grood idea..."
11212111.content:
"Certainly sir." The bartender responds as she begins mixing your drink. "Mmm... alright, this is officially the best vacation of my life!" You say excitedly as you take your first sip. "Keep em' coming, I'm gonna set a new personal drinking record." The night begins to wear on as the empty glasses start to accumulate on the counter in front of you. By midnight you're too wasted to dance or swim so you order one last drink before you head back to your room. "Onse, um, onse more pleash." You slur as you turn around to lean your back against the counter. "Okay... but I really think you've had enough sir..." The bartender says as she grabs another glass from below the counter. At some point you decided to go from simple martini's to hard liquor and were now starting to feel the effects. "God, e'll going to besh so hung ova tomorrow..." You say as you down your drink in two gulps and wobble to your feet. "D-do you need any assistance sir?" The bartender asks worriedly as you stumble a few feet from your chair and try to hold down the contents of your stomach.

So, you good bro? Or do you need some help?
11212111.title: A bit too much...

choices: You wake up with a monster hangover...
You wake up in somebody else's room... also with a monster hangover...
112121111.content: You stumble back towards the hotel as the whole island seems to jump and twist around you. "Ugh, look at that jackass..." A woman in a pink bikini calls out as you stumple over a trash can and throw up on the ground. "Urrg, hey... hey! Miez you on business, whooure!" You stutter as the woman shakes her head and leaves with her boyfriend. You get back to your feet and wobble the rest of the way up the sidewalk to the hotel. "Hesh baby, you lurkin hewt ternight." You say as you come across the same tan woman with the seashell necklace you saw at the bar checking into her room. "Uh... can you please leave me alone sir?" She says as she walks over to the elevator. "Hey forgant you than, your losh." You call as you bump into the front counter. After a few minutes you are back in your room falling asleep as the room twirls around you.
112121111.title: "Ah shit, I got the spins again..."

choices: Head over to the local dance club for some more partying
Head down to the beach and maybe catch some rays
1121211111.content: A warm beam of sunlight hits your cheek as you slowly begin regaining your senses. Your head felt like Bruce Lee had just taken turns punching it with Jackie Chan and your stomach felt like someone had just dumped a barrel of toxic waste in it. "Ugghh... ohhh... never a-again..." You moan as you walk over to the window and pull back the blinds to get a good look at the island. The bright rays sting your eyes and cause you to stumble back onto the bed with a soft thud. "Well, it looks like today is off to a great start then..." You say as you brush your teeth, get dressed, down some aspirin and a glass of water and head down to the lobby. It was already past noon, but you didn't want to waste one of your vacation days so you...
1121211111.title: Wakey wakey...

choices: Talk to the woman
Head back to the hotel
Wait for her to notice you
11212111112.content:
You head down to the beach for some rest and relaxation after your crazy night of alcoholism and stupidity. There were only a few other people and it wasn't very crowded despite the time of the day so you find a nice spot near the water and set up for a day of laziness. You sip on a glass of iced tea as you read a book you bought form the hotel as other guests splash in the water around you.

In the middle of the late afternoon you reach the halfway point of your book and decide to head back to the hotel for dinner when you meet a familiar face once again. It was the tan woman with the seashell necklace relaxing in a chair just a few feet away from you. If not for the fact that you happened to looked in her direction while packing up you probably wouldn't have even noticed her.

"Is she following me or something?" you wonder to yourself as you finish off your iced tea and put your book back in your bag. "I know this place is small, but I've run into her three times now...no way that can just be a coincidence." You take a long look out at the sea as the sun begins setting under a thin blanket of fluffy white clouds.
11212111112.title: You Again?

choices: put out the fire
get out
1121211112.content: what the how did i get here you say. there is fire everywhere adn a woman next to you holding you are you ok? what happened i say while holding my head and why is there a fire?
1121211112.title: You wake up in somebody else's room... also...

choices: Head downstairs and get to shelter
Head back to your room and search for clues about what happened to you yesterday

"This will definately help." You say as you flick the switch. A dim beam of light shines across the room and allows you to see just a little bit better. "According to this, I'm supposed to meet someone at this fancy restaurant tomorrow at 8:00 pm. It must be who I was with last night..." 11212112212.content:
With the wind and rain now blowing in full force you decided it was probably a good idea to stop pressing your luck and get the hell out of here. You put the note in your suitcase for safekeeping and head out the flooded front door into the half submerged resort. Many of the surrounding buildings and huts had extensive damage done to them by the weather and the flood waters were steadily climbing higher. This is definitely not where you want to be right now.

You slog through the rising water over to a path that led up the hillside into the jungle part of the tiny island. Hopefully, you'd run into someone else who could get you to safety, but if not you'd at least avoid drowning. After nearly twenty minutes of fighting against the chilling wind and icy rain you came to the top of a small cliff overlooking the beach and jungle. Above you was a path leading towards that mansion you had seen when you first arrived and below you was a steep trail leading to what looked like an old greenhouse of some kind.

You didn't like the idea of visiting either place but you were now well out of options and the storm wasn't letting up anytime soon. Do you head up to the mansion owned by the creepy guy or take your chances in some old building in the jungle?

1141111122222131312.content:
You wanted to go on... but the loss of everything you held dear, not to mention some sweet cheerleader poon, was too much agony to bear in this life. You took a final look at the outside world and crawled back into bed, never to awake. For two days you faded in and out of consciousness as the toll from hunger and dehydration wracked your body. Surely, this was the end for you... for all of humanity...

But it wasn't.

At the end of the third day without any food or water you heard the roar of wheels and gunfire fill the streets outside. Your eyes caught flashes of light that you thought were hallucinations just beyond your broken window. You were sure you were going mad in your last moments on this earth, that all of the chaos happening around you was just one last sick mad dream. Then a single voice rang out from the front door of your house.

"Is anybody there?!"

You opened your mouth to answer but your lips were dry and heavy from lack of hydration. You didn't have the stamina to get out of bed but couldn't miss this last chance at survival. You struggled to raise your arm and pound the wall behind your bed loud enough to get their attention. After a moment of tense silence you heard several more voices come from behind your barricaded door. "Hey, I hear something in here, get the general! We may have a live one!"

You pass out just as a few men in green camo break through your door and rush over to your bedside. You drift through an empty dreamless sleep for several hours before waking up in a bed inside some kind of medical tent next to a few others. An IV was stuck in your arm and a small plastic medical bracelet on your other hand had the words "NOT INFECTED" in big green print. A nurse walked in and offered you a lukewarm meal as you slowly rose up in your bed.

You ask her what the hell is going on and she apologizes before leaving to fetch a soldier to explain it to you while she tended to her other patients. A man with short blond hair and a beret stepped into the room with a smile and introduced himself as a member of the army rangers before going on to explain what had transpired over the last 48 hours. As it turns out some sort of deadly virus or plague that the US government had never dealt with before spread all across the nation and parts of Canada about a week ago.

Many people had contracted it and spread it without even knowing it and soon half the population was either dead or undead. Luckily, the military was able to coordinate a strong response to the infection with help from the U.N. and was able to mobilize enough ground forces and firepower to contain and neutralize most of those infected. There were still several states under heavy quarantine, but the worst was over and order would be restored soon.

Shocked at this amazing turn of events you devoured half of your bland hospital food and soon found yourself falling asleep again. True to the soldiers word the world slowly returned to normal as the bodies were collected and burned while police and local officials were reinstated. Progress was slow at first but the news that the last of the known zombies had been killed or captured greatly improved morale among the survivors.

Finally, after two long months of recovery and rebuilding, you found yourself back at the gas station standing behind the counter in the early hours of the morning. Of course your worthless boss had survived all this, somehow, and was back to getting on your case about getting your job done. You rub your head as the affectionate woman with the dog walked in to pay for gas and buy a doggie treat for her precious little baby.

You struggle to smile as you hand her the meager amount of change owed from her purchase and wish her a good day. As you put the money into the register you think back on everything you had seen and done over the past few months. All the blood, death, destruction and nightmares you had come to terms with... the walking dead, the loss of loved ones, the agony of sheer hopelessness, the pain of coming within inches of death only to be pulled back from the brink at the last second.

Remembering all that suffering made you realize one very important thing though... you'd gladly take it all back if it meant you didn't have to spend another tedious minute in this goddamn garbage fucking shithole of a gas station! SERIOUSLY, FUCK THIS JOB!!!

Of course with all of the fake charities and scam artists these days you'd have to be careful not to give it to someone undeserving. So...who gets your Chuck Norris coins?
115122.title: Its For A Good Cause...Maybe...

choices: You reply, “me?”
You drop everything and run
115123.content:
You hold the coin the the light and see a small ridge, as if where foil connected. Grabbing it with your nails, you pull it open. As soon as you make the slightest incision, a deafening scream erupts from the gold dime. Dropping it, you look around, no one was there to see that.

Suddenly, fire erupted from the ground and a hellish portal broke through the tiles of the store floor. A giant broad figure rose out of it, screams and yells of pain echoing from the hole he rose out of as a demonic like choir started to sing dull tones. It reached it full height, which had it nearly pressing his head against the roof, and point an arm towards you, a skeletal finger sliding out from the clock.

“You.”

The voice came from behind you, to your sides, from the figure, from inside you own head, from everywhere all at once. It was like there were a thousand speakers. You knees start to tremble.
115123.title: Open the coins to see if there is any chocolate...

choices: Go to the right
Take the left path
1151231.content:
A meek “me?” escapes you quivering lips. Your eyes fill with horrors as the figure before you drops their arm, their shoulders slouching, taking on the posture of an annoyed teenager.

“Urgh... yeah you. Who else would I be... nevermind. come on I’ve got like huuundreds of people to get through today.”

Nervously you walk around the counter and towards the hulking shadow like entity. The air around you seems to become colder, your teeth hissing at you as you take sharp breaths. Just before you reach the edge of the circle you see the figures arm reach towards you out of the corner of your eye. As the skeletal hand comes into contact with your head, your eyes go wide and vacant.

You feel as if you’ve been ripped away from your body itself, the only thing you can see seeming to come from your mind itself as vibrant colours flats before your minds eye, throwing you down a giant mental hole as I feel you where on some sort of drug related trip.

Before you could fully understand what was going on your whole being slams to the cold stone floor of a cavern. Red flame torches cast leering shadows about you as you stand, brushing yourself down. The pathway head of you leads either left or right and you ponder the correct direction.
1151231.title: “Yes you.”

choices: "Wow, that's pretty generous of you. Thanks."
"Aw sweet! I love your music! I'll definitely be there!"
"Screw off, I hate your music AND your fashion sense."
1152.content:
A woman wearing what could be a dress or a modern art piece steps up to the counter and asks for a bag of chips for the road. "Sure thing ma'am, plain, sour cream or BBQ?" you reply as you head over to the snack rack. The strange woman thinks a moment and then asks for a pack of the most asymmetrical chips you have. You shrug and grab a pack of the kind that has the little ruffles and adds it to her total.

"That's $5.69 for the gas and the chips, say, aren't you Lady Gaga?" you ask as you pack the chips in a bag and hand it over to her. She laughs and takes off her sunglasses to get a better look at you. "Of course, who did you think I was? I'm on my way to a big show in the next state." she replies as she places a hundred dollar bill on the counter. "If you want I can give you some spare tickets I have, it would be great if you could be at the concert tomorrow."
1152.title: Going Gaga

choices: Go home after shift
Go to friends house after shift
Run into Neil Patrick Harris on your walk home
1153.content:
He walked in the door and came right up to the counter, "thirty on number three."
I was confused that NPH gets out of the limo to pump his own gas, but replied anyways, "Alright, is that it?"
"No let me get the US weekly magazine too."
I rang him up and he paid, then asked for the bathroom, I allowed him to use the employee bathroom since, I mean come on, it's Neil Patrick Harris. Time went by and he was still in there. It had been roughly twenty minutes when he finally came out.
"Hey gas station guy...I would not go in there for awhile."
I laughed just to be friendly to overcome this awkward situation, "it's cool."
"He goes yeah I know its cool that's why I paid thirty dollars for gas."
"What?" I asked as I was very curious and nervous about what had happened.
"Yeah I just took a shit all over the floors...too many bean burritos and my boy was banging me from behind."
I was flabbergasted at the event that just occurred, "What, are you serious?"
"Ha not at all, but I did jerk off to a picture of myself in US weekly, and it sprayed all over the door, yeah my bad, but I just paid thirty for gas and I have a full tank already so that should cover it."
He walked out as I stood there speechless. Thank god my shift was basically over so there was no need for me to clean it. Looking on the bright side, I now have thirty extra dollars for tonight.
1153.title: Neil Patrick Harris

choices: Michael notices the limo parked out front
NPH joins the video game over Xbox LIVE
11532.content:
With the interesting shift left behind, I decided to go to my buddies house, Michael, and maybe play a bit of video games. When I arrived, he was outside playing road hockey with his two brothers. I waved and joined the game, taking sides with Michael.
After scoring a goal and cheering, I noticed the same limo from the gas station pass by. I decided to tell Michael and his brothers the story about it, and they did not believe me at all. After elaborating attempts, I gave up and kept playing road hockey.
Thirty minutes later, the limo passed a second time, but slower. The four of us watched it drive by, moving the hockey nets to allow it to pass because this time it was closer. After it was gone, we all thought it was best to go inside, and we started to play Xbox.
11532.title: Go to friends house after shift

choices: Pinkie Pie was the only pony name I knew, just go ahead and put whatever...
Seriously, I don't know any other names, go with whoever you want...
115322.content: You and your buddies decide it is best to get in a little 360 time before the day is over so you head inside and boot up the console. (Normaly, you would be playing Gears Of War 3 or Modern Warfare 3... but since this is a none too serious comedy interactive you have a different game in mind.) "I call dibs on Pinkie Pie!" You say as you turn on your controller and put "My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic: The Game" into the machine. "Aw, I wanted Pinkie Pie..." Michael says as he turns on his own controller. "Tough luck, I called dibs." You say as you enter the online lobby, only to find that particular pony already taken. "Hey, some noob already took her!" One of Michael's brothers said as he quickly selected his own pony. "Hey wait, this guys gamertag is N3al P@tirck Hari$$... Neal Patrick Harris joined our game!" You exclaim as you go to select your pony. Unfortunately, most of the good ones are taken, leaving you stuck choosing...
115322.title: Friendship is PWNAGE!

choices: A robber pulls a gun on you and demands money
A police crusier pulls off the highway outside
You notice a fire burning outside off in the distance
A group of tough-looking goth punks show up
You see something fall out of the sky and crash outside across the road
12.content: You yawn sleepishly as you step behind the counter to begin your first night shift at the local gas station. "God, what the hell was I thinking?" You moan as you rub your eyes. "If I had taken the day shift then at least I wouldn't be so tired..." The hours pass slowly as you occupy yourself by cleaning the floors, restocking the shelves, and staring out the window at the empty road, hoping that someone would come along just to alleviate your boredom. You begin to doze off at around 2:00 am when you hear a noise outside, or at least you think you did... You are about to doze off a second time when...
12.title: Night owl

choices: Hit the alarm!
Grab the shotgun and confront this motherfucker!
Be a coward and do nothing...
121.content: You look up to see a man in a ski mask pointing a handgun at your forehead. "Give me all the goddamn money in the register... oh, and a lottery ticket." He snarls as as he waves the gun around your face. Hoping to live long enough to see day 2 of your crappy new job you do as he says. Just as you are about to hand over the meager contents of the cash register you drop some change on the floor. "Pick that shit up!" The man growls as he begins putting the rest of his loot into a plastic bag. You bend down and begin picking up the dropped coins when you notice 2 things... the alarm hidden under the counter and the loaded double-barrel shotgun the boss keeps here in case of a robbery. The mans seems to be distracted at the moment...
121.title: A bad night gets worse

1211.content: You activate the alarm that will call the police and alert them to the robber, there's just one problem... it isn't silent. A loud siren screeches as bright red lights begin flashing on and off at a rapid pace. You may as well have worn a "Just shoot me." shirt to work, at least that would've been quick. "You little cocksucker..." The robber growls through gritted teeth. "No, wait, that was-!" Before you can finish the man fills you full of lead until his gun is empty. "Aw, fuck...!" He then yells as he throws the gun down next to your bloody corpse and flees from the approaching police officers.
1211.title: Your boss is an IDIOT!

choices: Pull the trigger, maybe you can take him by surprise...
Try to reason with him
Try to get him to back down
1212.content: You take a deep breath, pick up the shotgun, and jump up with it pointed right at the robber. "Oh hell no you don't!" The masked man exclaims as he points his gun right between your eyes. "Crap..." You think to yourself as you steady your aim and brace yourself to pull the trigger. You let this wacko keep his gun on you and you arn't even sure if yours is loaded. Oh well, no time to back out now. "Look, we can both walk away from this..." You mutter, trying to sound brave and in control. "Just put your gun down... and I'll call the cops. Jail time is better than dying, right?" The man only sneered and presses his gun harder against your forehead. "I just killed my girlfriend and shot 2 cops over on the interstate about 15 minutes ago... wasting some punk who tried to pull a gun on me is nothing compared to what I'll have to face if they catch me." You weaken your grip on the shotgun slightly and try not to look worried, which is useless as you were now visibly sweating. This guy was a stone cold psychopath... and you were in trouble.
1212.title: A bold move... but can you follow through with it?

choices: Tell the truth
Lie
Punch this guy right in the fucking balls
12121.content: The robber's eyes go go wide in shock as a massive basket ball sized hole is blown through his torso, sending him flying backwards into a display stand. "JESUS CHRIST!" You yell in shock as the mans body stops twitching and goes limp. "What the hell kind of ammo did they put in this damn thing?!" After dropping the shotgun to the floor you reach into your pocket, pull out your cell phone, and dial 911 as fast as your shaking hands will allow. In minutes several squad cars are parked outside as police tape is used to close off the crime scene. "Can you tell me what happened here, son?" An aged cop with a gray mustache asks in an almost friendly tone dispite the fact that a mangled dead body was being carried out behind him. "Uh... uh yeah officer... see..."
12121.title: SHOTGUNS DO NOT WORK THAT WAY! GOOD NIGHT!

choices: They want to give you a reward
They want to question you
They want to arrest you
121211.content:
You tell the cop the whole insane story and are surprised that he actually believes you. "Sounds like a case of simple self defense then." he says as he writes something down on a tiny notepad. "Just give us your full name, address and phone number in case we need to contact you. We've been after this son of a bitch for months now and I'd be lying if I said I wasn't glad someone finally took him out."

You nod your head and do as you're told. Once everything is squared away you are free to head home and take the rest of the night off. You hurriedly thank the cop and are soon out the door and on the road, wide awake from the shock of everything that has happened. Once you arrive at your house you immediately head to bed and try to get as much sleep as your horrified mind would allow.

Naturally, your royal asshole of a boss wants you to come in the next night despite what happened and you reluctantly agree to do it since you didn't have any other way of earning money at the moment. Just as you are about to step into the shower and get ready for another night in hell the phone rings and you answer it. To your immense surprise it was the police...
121211.title: Nothing But The Truth

choices: One week of immunity from all laws
Your own fully stocked S.W.A.T. van and access to the police database
Your own personal team of elite police bodyguards
1212111.content:
On the other end of the phone was the cop you met at the gas station and he sounded pretty happy that he could finally close the file on that robber douchebag. You thank him for calling and telling you everything is okay but he stops you before you can actually hang up the phone. Confused, you listen to him talk about how they were able to trace the guy to several other big crimes including drug trafficking, making counterfeit cash and voting third party in the last presidential election.

As it turns out this made you eligible for a big reward, but the department had trouble deciding on what exactly it should be so they left the choice to you. All you had to do was drop by the station when you wanted to receive it and they'd take care of everything. You thank the officer again and finishing getting ready for work. Luckily, you had just enough time to hit up the police station before work and claim...
1212111.title: Stopping Crime Does Pay

choices: "See, it all started earlier... a giant robot showed up to buy chips..."
"Everything was going great, then the communists showed up..."
121212.content: "Crap, I'm in some deep shit here." You think as you try to come up with a plausible story. "There isn't any way they'll buy the truth with that giant hole I blew in his torso, I'll have to make up a lie to get out of this!" You open your mouth and begin your tall tale...
121212.title: Like they would ever believe the truth...

121213.content: Without so much as another word you wind your fist up and smash it right into this guy's beanbag. You hear a sound like two grapes being smashed with a cinder block as the officer falls to his knees and chokes out some words that sound like muffled curses. You start to wonder just what the hell came over you when the cop whips out his gun and nails you right in your own balls. Bummer. Your last few thoughts are barely coherent from the pain of bleeding out through your nads and you quickly pass out from shock. That's what you get for going nuts like that.
121213.title: Well, What Did You Think Was Gonna Happen?

12122.content:
"Look, what... what if I just let you go..." you say softly as you lower your shotgun a bit, eager to just put an end to this mess and get on with your life. "Please, don't make me laugh! I'm gonna waste your ass AND get away!" the robber taunted as he stared into your eyes with cold bloodlust. "No... no, please..." you mumble as your sweaty hands grip the shotgun tighter. You open your mouth again to beg for your life only for everything to go black as a loud bang breaks the silence.

Seems you lowered your shotgun a little too far, allowing the man to put a bullet right between your eyes. In a few hours some cops would catch him attempting to hijack a car several miles outside of town... and a couple men would find your corpse as they came in to pay for a fresh tank of gas...
12122.title: Never let your guard down at gunpoint...

choices: Keep trying to intimidate him
Offer to join him as a partner
Pull the trigger and hope for the best
12123.content:
"Look if we keep this up for much longer we'll both end up eating a bullet tonight... is that what you want?" you ask in a somewhat confident tone as you desperately try to think of a way out of this. The robber sneers as he looks you in the eye. "You'll crack long before me, boy... and when you do I'm gonna waste your sorry ass for pulling a gun on me and walk out that door with all your cash anyway. Trying to shoot me will be the last mistake of your pathetically short life." he replies, his voice barely above a low growl.

You take a deep breath as you slowly inch the shotgun closer to his chest. This situation was getting more dangerous by the second, but a bluff might be the only thing that could save your life at this point. "Are you sure about that?" you ask with a cocky grin, hoping to mask your fear. "Look around, I'm working a dead end job in the middle of bumfuck nowhere. You think I care if some shitstain robs this place blind? No, but I will gladly clip your ass if you so much as think about pulling that trigger."

The robber frowns as he lowers his pistol a bit and looks you over. "Hmmm... not bad, kid. But you're not fooling anyone. I can sense killing intent a mile away and you don't have any bloodlust in your mannerisms or voice. Nice try though." he replies as he refocuses his gun on your forehead. "Damn! I almost had him!" you think to yourself. This little standoff would probably be coming to an end soon... and your next choice would decide if you see the end of it alive or dead...
12123.title: Social Showdown

choices: Pick it up and tell him what happened
Pick it up and say nothing happened
Don't pick it up
1213.content:
"You really want the money, here take it," as I pressed the alarm under the counter. The alarm went off, but I realized the cops would not be here for awhile. I slowly arose from the table feeling foolish after making a catch phrase for this anticlimactic situation. He laughed and pointed the gun at my head, "Now give me two good reasons why I shouldn't kill you."
"two?" What's my luck that I have to come up with two good reasons instead of one? "Well I can get you some more free lottery tickets"
"And...?"
This guy was actually serious, "and you can take my car...?"
"What kind of car is it?"
"Ford Fiesta" I said proudly
"Oh, I hear those are very fuel efficient"
"And with a 6-speed twin-clutch unit" braggingly saying, uninterested in the fact I had a gun to my face"
"Very cool, that works here hand me the keys." I gave him the keys and then he added, "Ok well I'm gonna get going, but we should hang out sometime." The robber walked out the door leaving me more confused then ever. Then my phone started ringing. It was my manager.
1213.title: Try to be a hero

choices: Step outside and see what the problem is...
Ignore it, that cop should be on his way soon enough...
Try to get a glimpse of what's going on through the front window...
122.content: A loud blaring siren jolts you awake as a police crusier pulls off the highway and parks in the ditch a few yards from the gas station. "Oh, somebody's in trouble..." You mumble as you stare at the flashing blue and red lights just outside the window. "Wish I could see from this angle... oh well, maybe that cop'll come in and buy a donut or something when he gets done with whoever's out there." A few minutes pass, but the siren doesn't stop. "Jeez, how long does it take to write a goddamn ticket? What did this guy do, rob a bank?" You groan as you rub your forehead. After nearly ten minutes of this you begin to grow annoyed...
122.title: What's going on out there?

choices: You find the cop sitting on the ground next to the door
The cop's body has been violently dragged to the other side of the road...
No one is there... no police officer... no corpse... nothing...
1221.content: "God... I'm already tired... I am not putting up with this!" You say angrily as you open the door and step outside. The night air is cool and crisp, but you weren't very concerned about catching a cold at the moment. "This guy better be dying..." You groan as you zip your jacket up and head over to the crusier, which seemed to be crashed in a ditch. Its entire front hood was a mess and bits of shattered glass from the broken window were all over the ground, glittering in the moonlight and soft glow of the blaring sirens. "Oh my god... oh my god, I didn't mean it!" You yell out when you realize that this guy might actually be dead...
1221.title: That is probably not a good sign...

choices: You hear the cop scream!
Something breaks in through the back door!
12211.content: "H-help me..." A voice calls weakly from the side of the car. You walk over to find a middle aged man with a mustache sitting on the ground clutching his side, which was bleeding pretty badly. "Holy shit! What happened to you?" You ask as you lean down to help him up. "Something... SOME THING jumped out at my car about a mile down the road. I tried knocking it off, but the damn thing broke the window and slashed my side. It... it fell off the hood as I made a sharp turn to avoid running into the ditch... I... I drove the rest of the way here and must have passed out once I stumbled out the door..." The officer said as you propped him up over your shoulder and helped him inside. "We've got to stop the bleeding, my boss keeps a first aid kit in the back room, I'll go get it." You say as you hurry into the other room. Just as you're about to pick up the first aid kit...
12211.title: Something is on the loose...

choices: Try to run past it out the back door
Try to run back out to the front of the gas station
122112.content:
You go to grab the first aid kit and hurry back, but just as you are about to reach out and take it a loud thump echos from the back door! "Hello? Who's there? Go around to the front please..." You mutter worriedly as another louder thump sounds and the door begins to creek a little. You take a deep breath and are about to just grab the first aid kit and run back out to the cop when the door finally gives way and splinters into several pieces that go flying around the room. A large part of the door manages to cut your wrist and a few bits of wood pierce your thick clothes, but you barely avoid most of the biggest and sharpest pieces. Your hand and a few small cuts were bleeding now, though you didn't have time to react to your fresh wounds before your eyes fell upon the thing that had broken the door.


It had a long, thin wooden frame that looked to be made of bits of sticks tied with string and metal wire wrapped around bits of cloth. Its head was covered in a thick cloth sack with its eyes hidden and its long wooden teeth were the only thing exposed. Its arms had more bits of torn cloth wrapped around them carefully and its massive hands ended in razor sharp claws. The monster looked like a demonic scarecrow and was about 7 feet tall, even though it seemed to be leaning forward to get inside the doorway. For a few seconds you could only watch in horror as it slowly made its way inside, sporting an evil grin as it now stood at its full height of eight and a half feet. "FUCK..." You gasped as you quickly realized just how screwed you probably were...
122112.title: Night of the scarecrows

choices: Try to save the cop
Make a run for it
Look for a way to stall the monster
1221122.content:
You immediately ran for the front door as the scarecrow slowly stalked forward, clearly savoring every moment of your terror. You slam the wooden door shut behind you and lock it with your key. "Shit...SHIT!" you yell in a panic as you step back and turn towards the counter. The cop was still there and seemed to be struggling to his feet, though it was unlikely he would get far with his injury.

You glance down at the first aid kit in your right hand, somehow you had remembered to grab it before leaving. You take a deep breath as you look to the cop again and then to the door leading outside. You could try to get the police officer patched up or just make a run for it and leave him to his fate. In fact, that might actually stall the monster and help you get away. Of course, you didn't like the idea of just leaving this guy to die...

A loud thump on the door told you that whatever you chose to do... you better do it quickly!
1221122.title: Time To Go...

choices: There is an old man in a black robe by the fire
There's a huge bonfire with dozens of naked, dancing women
Hell with this, back to the gas station you go
123.content:
You blink and then stand motionless for several moments. No reason to act hasty now, is there? Haven't you gone through this sort of thing before, only to be chagrined later to find a man in a red coat, or a shaggy red dog? The bell over the door dings, but you ignore it. What they say about drugs, you reflect, is mostly true. They are mostly bad. And you just got this job. Shame to throw it away on another fictional fire; so you stand and blink again, and then stare (meanwhile the bell over the door dings again) off into the distance at the bright orange dot, waiting for it to disappear.

When it doesn't, you head outside to get a better look. Behind you, some doofus wants to buy a pack of Juicy Fruit gum, but you ignore him. Yep, that's a fire all right, but no one should be out there, it's a ghost town. Or an empty canyon. Or a deserted desert. You can't remember which. Only that there are no turn-outs near here, and local law enforcement discourages exploration by drifter.

As you watch, the orange dot briefly flickers before going out. Then pops into view again, the mystery again. Almost, you reflect, as though someone out there had briefly passed in front of it. But the road ahead is a roaring monster, big trucks screaming by, dust and smoke rising, and on the other side, well-posted No Trespassing signs.

What the hell is going on out there anyway? You don't really know the area. Could the locals be having a bit of a get-together? Because if so, that would sure as hell beat the shit out of this boring shift. They might even have a little bit of smoke, you reason.

Then, looking around, watching the doofus inside, you reflect that the pumps are automatic anyway. Insert credit card, get gas. Duh. Hardly a pressing need for you to be here every second of every moment of every night. A little walk then, across the road, hey?

Behind you, as you're starting out, the doofus calls, spilling change from his wallet. Ahead, another truck roars, more dust rises. Ignoring both, you climb a little rise on the other side of the road and start out seriously, hair swinging, even smiling a little in anticipation. Yeah, you think. You really could use a bit of smoke right about now.

Halfway there, however, the shit gets serious, and you stop, suddenly afraid. It smells like something bad out here, like death. I mean really bad. And though the fire appears closer, you don't see anyone, you don't hear anything. Where's the damn party? You blink and stare. And again passes that mysterious shadow in front of the fire.

And ug, what the hell is that stink?

But onward, right? Haven't you come this far? Behind you, the gas station waits like a bloated beast, with the road in front of it like a squashed snake.
123.title: You notice a fire burning outside off in the di...

choices: Walk up and say hi
Stay silent and watch
Sneak back to the gas station
1232.content: You move hastily through the weeds and try to remain out of sight of anyone who might notice you as you get closer. Suddenly, the silence is broken with soothing chanting in angelic voices, a chorus of sirens leading you forward. When your eyes finally fall on the dancing figures up ahead your mouth hangs open in shock. Before you are several nude women of all shapes and sizes dancing about the fire as their song fills the air. You feel compelled to make yourself noticed, but the last time you revealed yourself to a bunch of naked girls it got you expelled from high school.
1232.title: Dear Diary: Jackpot!

choices: The fire suddenly roars back to life
The woman are enveloped and clothed by shadows
The women transform into supernatural beings
12322.content:
You decide to stay put in the thin patch of weeds as the chanting gets louder and fills the air around you. Every other noise from the buzzing insects to howling animals seem to disappear as the women continue their song. You are beginning to feel unnerved, but its too late to head back to the gas station now...any movement would likely get you noticed.

Soon, the fire begins flickering a bit as the tone of the chorus shifts from light and angelic to lower and heavier, though still distinctly feminine. The fire goes down as their song slows a bit and begins to grow quieter with each passing minute. Finally, they speak their last note in unison and the fire sputters out in a puff of smoke and fades from existence. For a split second everything became dead silent until...
12322.title: Only You Can Prevent Chorus Fires

choices: Ask what he wants
Ask what was up with that one girl who tried hitting on you
Tell him that you've had enough of him and his friends, they have to leave now
124.content: The bell above the store rings softly as a group of goths step into the store and begin speading out to look around. "Oh god. I hope these guys don't cause any trouble." You think to yourself as a chubby goth girl in a Twilight t-shirt walks up and puts a bag of gummi bears on the counter. "Do you sell rope here... or chains?" You give her a strange look and make sure your hand is ready to hit the alarm if these people try anything. "Umm... no, sorry. We don't really have anything like that here." You reply, while trying your best to not sound suspicious. "Oh, that's okay honey, this'll be all then. Maybe you could even come to our party later, I would LOVE to have someone like YOU there." She says with a sly smile as she walks back over to one of her friends. You shiver as you fight the urge to say something back to her. She looked like she could be as young as FOURTEEN and she acted like she was hitting on you. Didn't her parents teach her any better then that? You are just about to turn away and ignore these people when a tall man with a spikey haircut walks up to the counter... and just stares at you.
124.title: Gotta love the night shift

1241.content:
I look him in the eye and said. "What is it you want?" The tall man snarled "I want all your money" as he brandished a knife. "All MY money," I laughed, "I only have 73 cents of MY money - happy to give that to you though if it sees you through." (There was no way a knife, even attached to a three foot arm, would be able to reach me from the other side of the counter.
The tall man with the spikey hair looked dumbstruck (emphasis on dumb) and then recovered saying, "You smartass. I meant all the money in the register."
I admit, I am a born smartass. I said, "That money doesn't belong to me. It belongs to the gas station. You know that logically it is impossible for me to give you what I do not possess. This is not my money and I therefore cannot give it to you. Technically, I would be stealing it from the gas station to give it to you."
"Just shut your freakin' mouth and give me all the money you can get your hands on. " he said with rising irritation.

I smiled again and congradulated him on being on a future episode of, "America's Dumbest Criminals" Now looking bewildered, the tall man said, Just what's that supposed to mean?"

Oh well, once you were done you could come back and enjoy this place properly. "I see." you reply as you rub your chin. "Any idea where he may have run off to?" The bartender thinks for a moment as she tries to remember what he had said before leaving.

You grab hold of the strange explosive with both hands and pull with all your might. To your immense surprise it slowly comes free from the dirt and pops loose with one final good tug. You fall backwards onto your ass as the thing lands in the weeds in front of you with a soft thud. "Well, I got it loose, time to see what this damn thing actually is... hope I don't blow myself up..." you say nervously as you get back on your feet and turn the thing over to get a better look at it in the moonlight.

Three strange crystals fitted to the underside begin glowing upon being turned out of the shadows and radiate a soft humming noise. You cross your fingers and pray that you don't blow yourself up as you point the gems towards the moon and they glow a bit brighter. Now that you had a better look at the device you could see that it was a pale grey with strange symbols plastered on the side next to some sort of compartment. "So far so good I guess." you whisper as you try to figure out what to do next.
125131.title: Are You Sure You Should Be Messing With It?

You refuse.
You say you'll fix their ship instead.
1252.content:
"It's probably nothing." you assured yourself, returning to your work. "Besides, it'll still be there in the morning, I can go check it out then."

As you continued to work, you heard what sounded like a badly tuned car pulling in to the service station. Sighing, you walked out to inform whoever it was that the mechanic would not be in until morning. Only that thought left your mind the instant you saw what only could be described as an alien craft, floating slightly above the ground with a badly dented front. "What the hell!?" was all you could say, though your mind was running a mile a minute.

Suddenly, a seamless door opened and two small... individuals walked out on three legs, talking to each other in a strange but irritable tone as they both waved three arms with four fingers. They stopped talking as I spoke.

"Um... May I help you?"

"Mister I know the universe like the back of my hand," said one alien, pointing to the other, "got us lost! We ran out of fuel and crashed onto your world."

"We need, I believe, what you call liquid plutonium." said the second alien, more meekly.

You were surprised that they were able to speak English but... a customer was a customer...

"I'm sorry but the strongest we carry here is diesel." you replied, apologetically. you then looked at their ship. "I can take a look at your front end, though. Maybe we can use some old car parts to patch her up with."

The second alien smiled slightly. "Souvenirs!"

The first alien smacked the second with a firm four fingered hand. "What good will they do without fuel, Newt!?"

"Aw, back off, Repulsa!" said Newt. "Maybe we can modify something."

Repulsa sighed, rolling her three eyes then spotted a nuclear power plant in the far distance. "We can use the waste from that primitive fission reactor complex." she said. "It should not cause any permanent problems for this world." she then turned to you. "Perhaps you would like to help us."

You gulped, knowing you were going to be in trouble either way.
1252.title: Stay here and ignore it, you don't want to ...

The robot is a figment of John Smuckley's imagination

"When will the cops show up and investigate this thing?" asked the nervious jervious who was now thinking about quiting this job, like he had quit every job he ever had in his short life of 24 years.

The gas station attendant, John Smuckly, stared down at his leg shaking uncontrollably and then had the audacity to ask himself, "Why didn't the Army accept me like they did the rest of my friends?"

"Hello," said the metal skinned robot to John Smuckly, who was stilll trying to calm his shakey leg.

"Huh?" asked John, and then immediately closed the drawer on the cash register, which was open because before the crash he had planned to steel a few bucks from it and simply not give his next customer a receipt.

The robot scratched its head and said to itself, "Does not compute. What is this strange word not in our data base?"

Hardly anyone stopped by and those that did were quickly on their way after buying snacks or paying for gas. By noon you were seriously considering leaving, even working at McDonald's would be better then this. The only thing that kept you from walking away was the fact that you really needed the extra money and this was the only way you were going to get it. Still, if you didn't find something to do soon you'd lose your mind...

You are a bit annoyed that your mom called you at work, but figure it must at least be important so you try not to sound bored. "Hey mom, what is it?" you say as a man in an RV pulls up outside. "Honey, it's just awful...I forgot how to set the DVR on the television!" she replies in an exasperated tone.

You roll your eyes and try to hide your frustrated tone as you give your mother the simple instructions she should really know by now. "Thanks so much honey, have a good day at work!" she says happily as the phone clicks off. You rub your forehead as the man with the RV walks in to pay for his gas.

"Hey there, little lady. Think you could grab me a snack for the road?" he says as he pulls out his wallet and puts a couple of fives on the counter. "Uh sure, what can I get you sir?" you ask as you take the money and put it in the register. The man merely gives you a smile as he puts his wallet away and rests a hand on the counter.

"Surprise me."

Then, right as you are about to get back to work a large cherry pie appears in front of you with a glob of whipped cream on top. Surprised by this turn of events you take a step back as a handsome, shirtless and muscular man erupts from the pie up to his barely concealed groin. Your eyes go wide and you drop the slushie to the floor as he gives you a big smile and lets out a hearty laugh. The cherry man laughs as he hops out of the pie and lands in front of you, the only thing covering his nether regions being a giant cherry. "Here they are! But alas, we have no time to talk! My entire world is in peril and threatened by unspeakable evil! I need your help to save it... please... will you help me?!" he asks as he grabs your hands tightly and looks into your eyes. It's not every day a giant nude cherry guy asks you for help saving his world, this was something to really consider.

"What about my job? If I leave the gas station I'll get fired you sure." you point out as the cherry man gives you a smile. "Fear not noble lass, for I shall take up your noble gas duties until you return! All I ask is that you save my people from certain doom!" he replies as he walks behind the counter and sticks a spare name tag to his gooey cherry chest. "I don't know..." you say reluctantly as you look around the store. "Do you know how everything works?"

"How hard can it be?! I'm the DUKE OF ALL CHERRIES after all!" he says excitedly as you rub your chin. Maybe this could work...? Do you even care anymore...?

The odd cherry man tosses you a large device that looks like some sort of red organic cell phone. "That's the cherry transporter, it will help you save my world and stay in contact with me!" he explains as you look over the weird contraption. "Good luck my dear!"
